message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Candida skin injection is used to test cell-mediated immunity, which is mediated by T-cells. Basophils and mast cells are involved in allergic reactions, and fibroblasts are involved in tissue repair.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The Candida skin injection is used to test the function of cell-mediated immunity. The induration, or swelling, at the injection site is an indication of a positive reaction mediated by T-cells. Basophils and mast cells are involved in allergic reactions and fibroblasts produce connective tissue, which is not relevant in this context.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The Candida skin injection test is used to assess cell-mediated immunity, which is primarily mediated by T-cells. Basophils, mast cells, and fibroblasts are not involved in cell-mediated immunity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cell-mediated immunity is mediated by T-cells, which are responsible for recognizing and destroying foreign or infected cells. Therefore, if there is no evidence of induration at the injection site, it suggests that T-cell mediated immunity may be compromised. Basophils and mast cells are involved in the immune response to allergens and parasites, and fibroblasts are involved in tissue repair and synthesis of extracellular matrix.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Candida skin injection is used to test for delayed-type hypersensitivity reactions, which are mediated by T-cells, specifically CD4+ and CD8+ T-cells. Basophils and mast cells are involved in immediate-type hypersensitivity reactions, and fibroblasts play a role in tissue repair and remodeling.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Candida skin test measures cell-mediated immunity, which is mediated by T-cells, specifically T-helper cells. They activate macrophages, promote B-cell activation, and direct cytotoxic T-cells. Basophils and mast cells are involved in allergic reactions and immediate hypersensitivity, while fibroblasts are involved in wound healing and tissue repair.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. In this case, a Candida skin injection is used to test for delayed-type hypersensitivity reaction, which is mediated by T-cells. Induration at 48 hours indicates a positive result, which means the T-cells have responded to the antigen. Basophils and mast cells are involved in immediate-type hypersensitivity reactions, while fibroblasts are involved in wound healing and tissue repair.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The Candida skin injection is a common test for assessing cell-mediated immunity. The absence of induration suggests an impaired cell-mediated immune response, which is primarily mediated by T-cells. Basophils and mast cells are involved in humoral immunity, while fibroblasts are not involved in the immune response.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The Candida skin injection test is a type of delayed hypersensitivity test that measures the cell-mediated immune response. The induration at the injection site is due to the infiltration of T-lymphocytes and macrophages. Mast cells and basophils are not involved in cell-mediated immunity, and fibroblasts are not involved in immune responses at all. Therefore, the correct answer is T-cells. As there was no evidence of induration at the injection site, it suggests that the child's cell-mediated immunity may not be functioning optimally.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The Candida skin injection is used to assess cell-mediated immunity. T-cells are responsible for mediating this type of response, while basophils and mast cells are involved in allergic reactions and fibroblasts are involved in wound healing. Since there was no induration at the injection site, it suggests a lack of cell-mediated immunity, which is mediated by T-cells.
